subject: RE: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: Especially when your code also contains well thought out log4j statements as you can always crank up the log level to track down a problem should the need

Especially when your code also contains well thought out log4j statements
as you can always crank up the log level to track down a problem should
the need arise.  The debug statements are then always there for the next
person who comes along rather than them having to start from scratch
with a debugger.

--
Jill

> -----Original Message-----
> From:	Erik Husby [SMTP:ehusby@...]
> Sent:	Friday, 16 November 2001 6:22
> To:	'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject:	RE: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
> 
> I don't want to sound patronizing, but I have found that by using JUnit I
> rarely need to use a debugger.
> I suggest that you revisit your JUnit tests -- let the code tell you what
> is
> wrong.
> 
> Failing that, I have had good luck with a product called BugSeeker by
> Karmira
> http://www.karmira.com/products/bugseeker2/
